title: Remainder Theorem Definition
text: The remainder theorem is as follows: if f(x) is being divided by $$(x-a)$$, then the remainder is equal to f(a). This means that we must plug in $$x=-6$$ into our dividend.
speech: The remainder theorem is as follows: if f(x) is being divided by  times, parentheses x minus a,  , then the remainder is equal to f(a). This means that we must plug in  x is equal to negative 6  into our dividend.
pacedSpeech: The remainder theorem is as follows: if f(x) is being divided by   times,  x minus a,
, then the remainder is equal to f(a). This means that we must plug in   x is equal to negative 6

title: Plugging In
speech: 5 x to the fifth, minus 4 x to the fourth, plus 3 x cubed, minus 2 x squared, plus x minus, 1  becomes 5(-6)**5-4(-6)**4+3(-6)**3-2(-6)**2+(-6)-1. This simplifies to  negative 44791 .
